For docker: 

By default all output to stdoud and stderr will be logged to a file in the host machine using json format (the logs for each container can be found in /var/lib/docker/) .   

* We can disable logging in docker by passing "--log-driver none" to the docker run. 

* It seems (I just read this, but could not confirm) that there is an issue with logging that could block the entire container if log stream buffers get filled (https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/22502). 
So they added new  options for logging to allow non-blocking logging. More info in the official docs: https://docs.docker.com/engine/admin/logging/overview/#options-for-all-drivers 

* Based on above, we could try running docker with "--log-opt mode=non-blocking"
